intro: Senecio claussenii, commonly known as the Cape York senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish to pale green flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Senecio claussenii is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
